availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Doniphan (Bracken County, Ky, circuit judge, state representative, and attorney )

body.p: Augusta, Kentucky, attorney. Augusta native. Son of George Doniphan and Mary Doniphan. Married to Elizabeth A. Ward Doniphan on December 16, 1856. Father of Mary S. Doniphan, George Doniphan, Christina Doniphan. Attended Augusta College. Clerk employed by George Doniphan from 1839 to 1842. Admitted to the bar in 1848. Attorney in Bracken County in 1850. Mayor of Augusta from 1852 to 1854. Attorney in Bracken County in 1860. Mayor of Augusta from 1860 to 1862. Judge of the ninth judicial district of Kentucky from 1862 to 1868.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Augusta, p. 452A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Augusta, p. 24.
"Joseph Doniphan" in The Encyclopedia of Northern Kentucky, Paul A. Tenkotte and James C. Claypool, eds. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2009), 278.
Find A Grave, "Joseph Doniphan (August 19, 1823-May 2, 1873)," Memorial #114273737, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/114273737 (accessed November 29, 2018).
